importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report on Doug Martin's death, indicating a recent and significant event in the sports world.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 through his retirement in 2018.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the first round of the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin had 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns during his career.
He earned Pro Bowl berths in 2012 and 2015, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers named him one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
The family confirmed his death on October 19, 2025, with the cause of death still unconfirmed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl berths in 2012 and 2015 and being named first-team All-Pro in 2015. He also recorded 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers honored him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The family confirmed his death on October 19, 2025, with the cause of death still unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
